snippet: By naming Scott Thompson as its new chief, the struggling Internet company sent a signal that it intended to try to fix its problems in the public domain, rather than taking itself private.
abstract: By naming Scott Thompson as its new chief, the struggling Internet company sent a signal that it intended to try to fix its problems in the public domain, rather than taking itself private.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

lead_paragraph: With the announcement of its new chief executive on Wednesday, Yahoo appears determined to chart its own course, rather than selling out.

headline.main: With New C.E.O., Yahoo Charts Independent Course
